stanza.line: Is it thy will thy image should keep openopen
My heavy eyelids to the weary nightnight
Dost thou desire my slumbers should be brokenbroken
While shadows like to thee do mock my sightsight
Is it thy spirit that thou send from theethee
So far from home into my deeds to prypry
To find out shames and idle hours in meme
The scope and tenure of thy jealousyjealousy
O no thy love though much is not so greatgreat
It is my love that keeps mine eye awakeawake
Mine own true love that doth my rest defeatdefeat
To play the watchman ever for thy sakesake
For thee watch I whilst thou dost wake elsewhereelsewhere
From me far off with others all too nearnear
